title: OS X Yosemite 10.10 (14A389) bootable USB (DMG File)
description:
OS X Yosemite 10.10 bootable USB (DMG File) (14A389)
Use the "Restore" option in Disk Utility to write it down on a USB-stick.

Enjoy!

How to do info..

Format Your USB Flash Drive

1. Insert the USB flash drive into your MacÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s USB port.
2. Launch Disk Utility, located at /Applications/Utilities/.
3. In the list of drives attached to your Mac, select the USB flash drive device.   In my case, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s called 14.9 GB SanDisk Cruzer Media.
4. Click the Ã¢â‚¬ËœPartitionÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ tab.
5. Select Ã¢â‚¬Ëœ1 PartitionÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ from the Volume Scheme dropdown menu.
6. Enter a descriptive name for your flash drive; I chose "USB Install Drive"
7. Select Mac OS X Extended (Journaled) from the Format dropdown menu.
8. Click the Ã¢â‚¬ËœOptionsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ button.
9. Select Ã¢â‚¬ËœGUID Partition TableÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ from the list of available partition schemes.
10. Click Ã¢â‚¬ËœOK and click "Apply"

Now the USB flash drive is prepared you can Restore "OS X Base System.dmg" to your flash drive.

1. Click on "Restore" in the Disk Utility window.
2. Drag "OS X Base System.dmg" to "Source"
3. Drag the usb flash drive (in my case "USB Install Drive") to "Destination"
4. Click "Restore" en enter your system password.
5. Done
